00023 #ifndef _GR_CIRCULAR_FILE_H_
00024 #define _GR_CIRCULAR_FILE_H_
00025 
00026 /*
00027  * writes input data into a circular buffer on disk.
00028  *
00029  * the file contains a fixed header:
00030  *   0x0000:    int32 magic (0xEB021026)
00031  *   0x0004:    int32 size in bytes of header (constant 4096)
00032  *   0x0008:    int32 size in bytes of circular buffer (not including header)
00033  *   0x000C:    int32 file offset to beginning of circular buffer
00034  *   0x0010:    int32 byte offset from beginning of circular buffer to 
00035  *                    current start of data
00036  *
00037  */
00038 class gr_circular_file {
00039   int            d_fd;
00040   int           *d_header;
00041   unsigned char *d_buffer;
00042   int            d_mapped_size;
00043   int            d_bytes_read;
00044 
00045 public:
00046   gr_circular_file (const char *filename, bool writable = false, int size = 0);
00047   ~gr_circular_file ();
00048 
00049   bool write (void *data, int nbytes);
00050 
00051   // returns # of bytes actually read or 0 if end of buffer, or -1 on error.
00052   int read (void *data, int nbytes);
00053 
00054   // reset read pointer to beginning of buffer.
00055   void reset_read_pointer ();
00056 };
00057 
00058 #endif /* _GR_CIRCULAR_FILE_H_ */
